citation.article-title: Trichococcus flocculiformis gen. nov. sp. nov. A new Gram-positive filamentous bacterium isolated from bulking sludge.

p.s: Description of Trichococcus flocculiformis sp. nov.
Trichococcus flocculiformis L. n. floccus a flock of wool; Med. L. dim. adj. flocculus like a small floc of wool; L. n. forma shape; L. adj. flocculiformis small-flocshaped.
Cells are spherical to ovoid, dimensions 1-1.5 μm by 1.0-2.5 μm.
Cells in filaments with about twenty to several hundred cells.
No branching.
Colonies on nutrient agar white, opaque, circular, convex with a lobate or erose margin.
GC base ratio: 46.8%
Blood agar plates: no haemolysis.
Indole: not produced.
Hydrogen sulphide: not produced.
Acetylmethylcarbinol: not produced.
Methyl red test: positive.
Acid production from: fructose, galactose, glucose, mannose, ribose, xylose, mannitol, cellobiose, lactose, maltose, sucrose, trehalose.
No acid production: D-, L-arabinose, erythritol, galactitol, inositol, ribitol, sorbitol, starch, agar, esculin, casein, cellulose, chitin, DNA, gelatin, pectin, tributyrin, Tween 80, urea.
No nitrate reduction.
Phosphatase negative.
Temperature: growth from 4 to 39°C, optimum 25-30°C. pH: growth from pH 5.8 to 9.0, optimum around pH 8.0.
Cell wall amino acids: ala, glu, asp, lys.
Fatty acids composition: C 12:0,2 × C 14: 1, C 14: 0, C 16: 1, C 16: 0, C 18: 1, C 18: 0.
Proportions depend on growth temperature.
Source: isolated from bulking sludge in five sewage treatment plants in West Germany.
Type: strain Echt, deposited at the DSM, Göttingen: no. 2094.
